means: 被…吸引住，专心致志，全神贯注
专心致志地，全神贯注地
吸收（液体、气体等）( absorb的过去式)
使全神贯注(absorb的过去分词形式)

sentence.Network_en: He stopped and watched with amusement to see the child so absorbed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他停下来，饶有兴趣地看着孩子如此投入。

sentence.Network_en: Those who suffer from narcissism become self-absorbed or chronic show-offs.
sentence.Network_cn: 被自恋症折磨的人会变得只专注于自己的事情，或者不断地自我炫耀。

sentence.Network_en: Nutrients from the digested food can be absorbed into the blood.
sentence.Network_cn: 消化的食物中的营养成分能够被吸收到血液中去。

entry.tran: 极感兴趣的；专心的；全神贯注的
entry.def: If you are absorbed in something or someone, you are very interested in them and they take up all your attention and energy.

example.ex: They were completely absorbed in each other...
He had discovered politics and was rapidly becoming absorbed by it...
example.tran: 他接触到了政治并且迅速地对它着了迷。

sentences.sentence: "so intent on this fantastic...narrative that she hardly stirred"- Walter de la Mare

means.word_mean: 3. taken in through the pores of a surface;

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wandering about by himself, absorbed in his reveries.

Sentence.sentence: Nothing makes me feel better than being in one place, absorbed in a book, a conversation, or music.

means.word_mean: 被…吸引住；专心致志；全神贯注

sentences.en: He eyed the coming tide with an absorbed attention.
I am especially by math problems.
sentences.cn: 我对数学问题特别感兴趣。

sentences.en: A jigsaw puzzle can keep me absorbed for hours.
sentences.cn: 一副拼图就能让我沉醉几个小时。

sentences.en: She seemed totally absorbed in her book.
sentences.cn: 她好像完全被这本书迷住了。

sentences.en: The writer was so absorbed in her work that she did not hear her visitor enter the room.
sentences.cn: 那位作家全神贯注地写作,以至客人进入室内她也没有听见。
